page.title: 05WYKEHAM
page.content: Idyllic area set deep in countryside on opposite bank of River Bain to Girsby. Wykeham Hall is Victorian on site of earlier Jacobean House, in Parkland overlooking lake made only 30 years ago in bog area and stocked with trout for private fishing. Near the Hall are remains of small Church dem_ olished in 17th C but still with 2 memorial tablets and vaults below said to have been looted by troops billeted there in W.W.2. Still signs of early settlements at West & East Wykeham, decimated by Black Death Plague in 14th C. Today 14 adults & 7 children live here, all in Estate property. In addition to the Hall with a self contained flat retained by the owners, there are 9 houses, 2 being empty, 5 occupied by employees and 2 by people working elsewhere. _
